newsitem.title: USA: Recent stock activity not measure of economy - Rubin.
newsitem.headline: Recent stock activity not measure of economy - Rubin.

text.p: Recent stock market activity was largely irrelevant as a measure of the health of the U.S. economy, Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin said on Thursday.

"The fluctuations we have seen in last few months I think is somewhere in the neighborhood of irrelevant," Rubin said on Public Television's Newshour with Jim Lehrer when asked about the stock market as a barometer of the economy.
On the subject of the economy, Rubin repeated that he saw a continuation of solid growth with low inflation.
"We are doing very well clearly. In my view the most likely outlook is a continuation of solid growth and low inflation," he said.
